Description: Longitude of centroid of land area. Lat and Lon together are used as unique IDs for each block of land
creation_method: centroid of object in UDP

Description: Latitude of centroid of land area. Lat and Lon together are used as unique IDs for each block of land
creation_method: centroid of object in UDP

Description: Individual identifier of land area created by this repo
creation_method: row_number of dataset from stock data in 2016, with extra info for occasions where the stock data has been changed.

Data quality issues: Sometimes blank if there is no address. Not clean.

Description: Best estimate for the number of dwellings that are currently on the piece of land
creation_method: The UDP has an accurate measure of the number of dwellings on a property in 2016 (dwlgs_in_2016), then for developments with more than 10 units we use dev_dwlgs_total to see if there have been any additions from 2016-2022. We do not have data on small developments since 2016.
Data quality issues: Sometimes greenfield projects are listed as one large "development" when they are actually lots of smaller lots. Ideally we'd split these up into the subdivided properties

Description: Number of dwellings on site in 2016
creation_method: Urban Development Program Stock layer

Description: size of lot in square meters
creation_method: st_area function

Data quality issues: Extremely rarely more than one zone will cover the property in error. In this case we pick the zone with the biggest overlap

Description: Name of zone in broad groups
creation_method: Grouping of zone codes into convenient types. "Mixed Use Zone" is a grouping of lots of different zones that tend to allow high density. ("DZ","CCZ","CDZ","MUZ","ACZ","PDZ","RGZ", and "SUZ" in the Arden nad West Melbourne precinct.)
Data quality issues: A small number of "special development zones" have been labelled as commercial because it's the best category available, but these might permit some residential development

Description: Number of heritage overlay if there is one
Data quality issues: HO values are only unique within a council area. Extremely rarely more than one overlay will cover the property. In this case we pick the overlay with the biggest overlap

creation_method: Contains every property that's either zoned as HO by VICMAP or in the Victorian Heritage Database. Where the VHD provides the level of signficance this is provided.
Data quality issues: Port Phillip data was emailed by council. Linked by lat/lon so not perfect - especially when councils have one entry in the Victorian Heritage Database for a whole area of heritage.

creation_method: Victorian Heritage ID where it is available. You can visit the site of the ID by replacing the ID in this URL: https://vhd.heritagecouncil.vic.gov.au/places/13584
Data quality issues: Linked by lat/lon so not perfect - especially when councils have one entry in the Victorian Heritage Database for a whole area of heritage.

Description: T/F if there is any heritage
creation_method: Checks for any value in heritage_status

Description: Number of Design and development overlay if there is one
Data quality issues: DDO values are only unique within a council area. Extremely rarely more than one overlay will cover the property. In this case we pick the overlay with the biggest overlap

Description: Number of Neighbourhood Character Overlay if there is one
Data quality issues: NCO values are only unique within a council area. Extremely rarely more than one overlay will cover the property. In this case we pick the overlay with the biggest overlap

Description: Presence of VICMAP feature or zoning category, where any civic facility is deemed not suitable for development
creation_method: Pulled from civic land zones as well as VICMAP Features of Interest such as parks, schools, hospitals and train stations.
Data quality issues: Some civic facilities might be useful for development despite being grouped 'not for development' here - e.g. you could build on a train station car park.

creation_method: Only includes information about VICMAP Features of Interest such as parks, schools, hospitals and train stations.
Data quality issues: Some civic facilities might be useful for development despite being grouped 'not for development' here - e.g. you could build on a train station car park.

Description: Measure of how many traffic fumes and noise this property might experience relative to other properties in the dataset
creation_method: Created from database of traffic on major roads. Uses decay function of fumes related to distance from road as per this NBER paper: https://www.nber.org/system/files/working_papers/w15413/w15413.pdf
Data quality issues: EXPERIMENTAL. Not happy with results as they stand
non-vacant properties could have large non residential buildings in them and still have 0 dwellings

Description: Was the property undergoing construction in the stock dataset in 2016
creation_method: Stock dataset from 2016
Data quality issues: Only most recent development for a site included.

Description: id of any development on this site
creation_method: row number of dataset created by this repo
Year the development was completed. If blank could be the most recent year of the data

Description: Most recent year of UDP flow data in which this development apears
creation_method: All "flow" data from developments are sourced from the most recent year of the dataset where that development appears

Description: Number of homes on development site
Data quality issues: Only included for developments >10 untis, so any development <10 units since 2016 is not in this dataset

Description: Number of townhouses on development site
Data quality issues: Sometimes not included

Description: Number of dwellings on development site of unknown type
Data quality issues: Sometimes not included

Description: Number of apartments on development site
Data quality issues: Sometimes not included

Description: Number of houses on development site
Data quality issues: Sometimes not included

Description: Project name for this stage/section of any development on site
Data quality issues: Sometimes not included

Description: Project name for any development on site
Height of tallest building on development site
Has the most recent development on the site finished
Where land has been subdivided or consolidated, what was the original stock id that this piece of land came from
Is this property created by this repo?
creation_method: Where there is a development that only occurs on part of a property on the 'stock' layer - this is the leftover property. Often this is an error.

Description: ASGS area value - note that "Merri-bek" has been changed to it's new name, and if you are joining to other maps you might consider using lga_code_2022 which is unchanged
Haversine distance to the CBD in meters

creation_method: based on the zone_short and whether zoning permits housing in that zone_short
Data quality issues: Note: zoning may permit housing but there could be a feature of interest such as a school etc that makes new housing impossible

Description: Is there a feature of interest that makes development more difficult.
creation_method: Based on feature_type_short that would make development difficult
